thread.title: Super Bowl wagers at Monmouth Park? Track bets on it
thread.title_full: Super Bowl wagers at Monmouth Park? Track bets on it

author: app.com
title: Super Bowl wagers at Monmouth Park? Track bets on it
text:
MORE In the wake of Wednesday’s stunning decision by the Third Circuit Court of Appeals, Monmouth Park hopes to be accepting wagers on sporting events by the Super Bowl.
At least that’s what track officials and New Jersey legislators are hoping after the court decided to vacate the opinion by a three-judge panel in August and will have the entire court rehear the case for legalizing sports wagering in the state, breathing new life into a four-year fight led by Monmouth Park and the Christie Administration.
``It’s wonderful news,’’ said Dennis Drazin, adviser to the operators of Monmouth Park. ``We definitely hope to be taking bets by the Super Bowl.
``Usually you file these requests and it never happens. But this means we now have an opportunity to argue our case in front of the entire Third Circuit, and I think we have a real legitimate chance. There are clearly serious questions about the court’s two opinions, with Christie I and Christie II in conflict.’’
